intro: Phyllanthus lanceolatus, commonly known as the lanceleaf phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its simple, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsules that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Phyllanthus lanceolatus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
